intro: Selysia bidentata, commonly known as the two-toothed selysia, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apocynaceae. It is native to parts of Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are usually narrow and opposite, and the plant produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Selysia bidentata is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought.
